title: Sample-Efficient Learning for Dexterous Grasping
abstract: We present a novel reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. Our method demonstrates significant improvements in sample efficiency and task success rates compared to existing approaches.

title: One-Shot Imitation for Dexterous Tasks
abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations. We show that our approach can learn intricate manipulation behaviors from limited demonstration data.

title: Advanced Dexterous Manipulation Systems: A Comprehensive Review
abstract: This comprehensive review examines the current state of dexterous manipulation systems, covering hardware advances, control algorithms, and future research directions.
conference: IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)

title: Multi-Agent RL for Coordinated Finger Movement
abstract: We present a novel reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. Our method demonstrates significant improvements in sample efficiency and task success rates compared to existing approaches.

title: Optimal Control for Multi-Fingered Robotic Hands
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.

title: Behavioral Cloning for Multi-Finger Robot Hands
abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations. We show that our approach can learn intricate manipulation behaviors from limited demonstration data.

title: Language-Guided Manipulation with Robotic Hands
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents a vision-based reinforcement learning approach for dexterous manipulation tasks. The method leverages deep neural networks to learn complex motor policies from raw visual inputs, achieving high success rates in object reorientation and grasping tasks.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Human Demonstrations
abstract: This work explores imitation learning for dexterous hand manipulation by using human demonstrations as training data. The model is trained to replicate fine-grained hand movements, enabling robots to perform complex tasks with minimal supervision.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Robotic Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) model that integrates visual perception, language understanding, and robotic action generation. It enables robots to perform manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions and visual context.

title: Model-Based Control of Dexterous Hands Using Learned Dynamics
abstract: This paper proposes a model-based control framework for dexterous hands that uses learned dynamics models to improve control accuracy and stability. The method demonstrates improved performance in high-speed manipulation tasks.

title: Optimization-Based Motion Planning for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This research focuses on optimization-based motion planning for dexterous hand manipulation. The proposed algorithm efficiently computes collision-free and physically feasible trajectories for complex manipulation tasks.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation with Partial Observations
abstract: This paper addresses the challenge of dexterous object manipulation under partial observations using deep reinforcement learning. The approach improves robustness and adaptability in real-world settings with limited sensory feedback.

title: Learning from Demonstrations: A Hybrid Imitation and Reinforcement Learning Approach for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper combines imitation learning and reinforcement learning to improve the performance of dexterous hand manipulation. The hybrid approach allows for faster convergence and better generalization across different tasks.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Real-Time Robotic Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a real-time vision-language-action model that enables robots to perform dynamic manipulation tasks based on natural language commands and visual input. The system is designed for low-latency execution in complex environments.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Online Optimization
abstract: This paper presents an adaptive control strategy for dexterous robotic hands that uses online optimization to adjust control parameters in real time. The method enhances performance in uncertain and changing environments.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper explores the use of model predictive control (MPC) for efficient optimization in dexterous manipulation tasks. The approach balances accuracy and computational efficiency, making it suitable for real-time applications.

title: Trajectory Optimization for Dexterous Grasping
abstract: We propose optimization techniques for generating smooth and efficient trajectories for dexterous grasping operations. The method considers both kinematic constraints and dynamic stability requirements.

title: Learning from Demonstration for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations. We show that our approach can learn intricate manipulation behaviors from limited demonstration data.

title: VLA-Based Dexterous Manipulation Planning
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

title: Adaptive Control Strategies for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.

title: Expert Demonstration Analysis in Hand Manipulation
abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations. We show that our approach can learn intricate manipulation behaviors from limited demonstration data.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Hand Manipulation
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

title: Optimization-Based Grasp Synthesis
abstract: We propose optimization techniques for generating smooth and efficient trajectories for dexterous grasping operations. The method considers both kinematic constraints and dynamic stability requirements.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation
abstract: We present a novel reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. Our method demonstrates significant improvements in sample efficiency and task success rates compared to existing approaches.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents a vision-based reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks, demonstrating improved performance on object reorientation and grasping in unstructured environments.

title: Learning to Grasp by Imitating Human Demonstrations with Neural Radiance Fields
abstract: The paper explores the use of neural radiance fields to enhance imitation learning for robotic hand manipulation, enabling more accurate replication of human hand motions in complex scenarios.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This work introduces a novel vision-language-action model that enables robotic hands to perform complex manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions and visual input.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Contact-Aware Dynamics
abstract: This paper proposes a contact-aware model predictive control framework for dexterous robotic hands, improving stability and precision during high-contact manipulation tasks.

title: Optimization-Based Policy Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation
abstract: The paper presents an optimization-based approach for learning manipulation policies in dexterous robotic hands, achieving efficient exploration and task success in dynamic environments.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation Policies via Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This study demonstrates end-to-end deep reinforcement learning for dexterous hand manipulation, achieving state-of-the-art results on standard benchmark tasks using simulated and real-world data.

title: Imitation Learning with Hierarchical Action Spaces for Robotic Hand Tasks
abstract: The paper introduces a hierarchical imitation learning framework that improves the performance of dexterous robotic hand manipulation by decomposing complex tasks into subtasks.

title: Language-Guided Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Language-Action Transformers
abstract: This paper develops a vision-language-action transformer model that enables robotic hands to perform dexterous manipulation based on natural language instructions and visual context.

title: Robust Contact Modeling for Dexterous Manipulation via Optimal Control
abstract: This research focuses on optimal control strategies for dexterous robotic hands, emphasizing robust contact modeling to improve performance in uncertain environments.

title: Efficient Optimization for Real-Time Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: The paper presents an efficient optimization algorithm for real-time control of dexterous robotic hands, enabling faster and more precise manipulation in dynamic settings.

title: Force Control in Dexterous Grasping Systems
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning using Large Language Models
abstract: This paper explores the integration of vision and large language models (LLMs) to enable dexterous manipulation tasks through reinforcement learning. The approach leverages visual inputs and natural language instructions to improve task generalization and adaptability in complex environments.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation via Imitation Learning with Human Demonstrations and Neural Radiance Fields
abstract: This work proposes a novel imitation learning framework that uses human demonstrations combined with neural radiance fields to learn precise dexterous manipulation policies for robotic hands. The method improves upon traditional imitation learning by incorporating 3D scene understanding.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) model tailored for dexterous hand manipulation, enabling robots to understand natural language instructions and perform complex object manipulation tasks based on visual perception and action planning.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands with Uncertain Dynamics
abstract: This paper presents a model predictive control (MPC) approach for dexterous robotic hands that accounts for uncertain dynamics and contact forces. The method is validated on multiple robotic platforms and demonstrates improved performance in dynamic manipulation tasks.

title: Optimization-Based Policy Learning for Dexterous Manipulation in High-Dimensional Spaces
abstract: This paper proposes an optimization-based policy learning framework that enables dexterous manipulation in high-dimensional state and action spaces. The method integrates gradient-based optimization with deep reinforcement learning to achieve efficient and robust control policies.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents a hierarchical reinforcement learning (HRL) approach for end-to-end learning of dexterous manipulation policies. The method decomposes complex tasks into subtasks and learns policies at different levels to improve sample efficiency and task performance.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation Using Transformer Architectures
abstract: This paper explores the use of transformer architectures for efficient imitation learning in robotic hand manipulation. The model captures long-range dependencies in demonstration sequences, leading to more accurate and generalizable policies.

title: Vision-Language-Action Planning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action planning framework that enables dexterous object manipulation by combining visual perception, language understanding, and action execution. The system is evaluated on a variety of real-world tasks.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands via Model-Based Optimization and Adaptive Learning
abstract: This paper proposes a robust control strategy for dexterous hands that combines model-based optimization with adaptive learning techniques. The approach enhances performance in uncertain and dynamic environments through continuous adaptation.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Gradient-Based Meta-Learning
abstract: This paper investigates the use of gradient-based meta-learning to optimize dexterous manipulation policies. The method enables rapid adaptation to new tasks and environments, demonstrating strong performance in simulated and real-world settings.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation from Suboptimal Experts
abstract: We present a method for learning dexterous manipulation skills from suboptimal human demonstrations using reinforcement learning.

title: VLA-Hand: Vision-Language-Action Models for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks.

title: Imitation Learning for Complex Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: We explore imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations.

title: Optimal Control Strategies for Multi-Fingered Robotic Hands
abstract: This work presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks.

title: Policy Gradient Methods for Robotic Hand Control
abstract: We present a novel reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. Our method demonstrates significant improvements in sample efficiency and task success rates compared to existing approaches.

title: Multimodal Learning for Dexterous Robot Control
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

title: Real-Time Control of Anthropomorphic Hands
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.

title: Energy-Efficient Control of Robotic Hands
abstract: We propose optimization techniques for generating smooth and efficient trajectories for dexterous grasping operations. The method considers both kinematic constraints and dynamic stability requirements.

title: Motion Planning for Multi-Finger Manipulation
abstract: We propose optimization techniques for generating smooth and efficient trajectories for dexterous grasping operations. The method considers both kinematic constraints and dynamic stability requirements.
